definition: 7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)

sentences.english: After lunch my father dozes in his chair.
sentences.chinese: 喫過午飯後我父親總在他的椅子上打個盹。

sentences.english: Afterwards, we go back in for another lesson until lunch at 12:00.
sentences.chinese: 之後，我們回教室上另一節課，至到12點喫午飯。

sentences.english: Then we had lunch in a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 然後，我們在一家餐館吃了午飯。

sentences.english: We stop at Pin Wu for lunch, but Sam and David never come down.
sentences.chinese: 中途，司機在平武停下車喫午飯，鵬和嫣沒有下車。

sentences.english: Bring a lunch in a box.
sentences.chinese: 把午飯盛到一個盒子裏。

sentences.english: Last week, the Clarks had lunch at a restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 上週，克拉克一家在餐館喫的午飯。

sentences.english: After this presentation, we'll have lunch, which is served in the main conference hall.
sentences.chinese: 推介會之後，我們喫午飯，午飯在大會廳內。

sentences.english: After this presentation, we'll have lunch, which is served in the main conference hall.
sentences.chinese: 推介會之後，我們喫午飯，午飯在大會廳內。

sentences.english: It’s not appropriate to leave queues of taxpayers and go for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 放下排長隊的納稅人去喫午飯這實在是不怎麼合適。

sentences.english: They are waiting for their lunch in some steamy haus.
sentences.chinese: 他們在一間潮溼悶熱的房間裏等着喫午飯。
幾乎是喫午飯的時間了。

sentences.english: His father has a two-hour break after lunch every day.
sentences.chinese: 每天他的爸爸午飯後休息兩個小時。

sentences.english: We treated Mom to lunch at the Marriot.
sentences.chinese: 我們在萬豪酒店請媽媽請喫午飯。

definition: to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
to go to class/to attend class/to go to teach a class
